entry.title: picker: Move `PickerSearchResult` to ash/public
entry.content:
From an offline discussion, we would like to consolidate the general

"picker search result" class between `PickerClient` in chrome/browser/

and the code which lives in ash/.



This will be used as a result type returned from `PickerClient` for

`PickerController` for CrOS Search results. If we did not make this

public, we would need to wrap the returned `ChromeSearchResult` into a

new `PickerChromeSearchResult` type, and later convert

`PickerChromeSearchResult` to this `PickerSearchResult` type anyway -

see https://crrev.com/c/5251929/2 as an example.



Bug: b:316936687

entry.title: Turn on CVDisplayLink callbacks when a new feature needs it.
entry.content:
Currently, we only turn on CVDisplayLink callback for

CVDisplayLinkBeginFrameSource. (The feature is enabled by default.)

This CL checks for two more features NewPresentationFeedbackTimeStamps

and VSyncAlignedPresent to turn on CVDisplayLink callbacks.

This way we can test these features separately.



Also rename DelayOnFramePresent to VSyncAlignedPresent

the future). Helps prepare for stable ids CL:4185636.

entry.title: Add observation support to `ash::holding_space_metrics`.
entry.content:
Holding space wallpaper nudge experiment interaction metrics are

downstream of production holding space metrics and should be recorded

at the same time. As currently implemented, wallpaper nudge experiment

metrics APIs cannot be invoked directly from //ash/public/cpp/ as it

would cause a circular dependency. To work around this, observation

support is added in this CL so that wallpaper nudge experiment metrics

may be recorded at the same time as other production holding space

metrics.



Note that once the experiment is complete, wallpaper nudge experiment

metrics will be refactored such that they are inlined in the production

holding space metrics code path. At that point, observation support can

be reverted.



Bug: b:311411775

Change-Id: I5f3e8206b1a6d0213e2f769cc92806e5c09212da

entry.title: Store match-dest and id of dictionary into the SQL database
entry.content:
After https://crrev.com/c/5248489, Chromium parses "id" and "match-dest"

option of "Use-As-Ditionary" response header. But those information is

not stored in the SQL database. This CL adds the support.



To store the information, the SQL database needs to be updated as

following:



- Change the existing `id` field to `primary_key`.

- Add a new `id` field to store the "id" option.

- Add a new `match_dest` field to store the "match-dest" option.

- Add the `match_dest` to the `unique_index` index.

- Change kCurrentVersionNumber and kCompatibleVersionNumber from 1 to 2.



As the existing database scheme (version 1) is used only for the first

Origin Trial (M119-M122), we don't need to migrate the data from version

1 to the new scheme (version 2). So `DoMigrateDatabaseSchema()` method

just deletes the existing table `dictionaries` and the `total_dict_size`

metadata.



Bug: 1413922

Change-Id: Ia2841e4f022cc48cf766b51639cd7047f6a1bc81

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5271881

Reviewed-by: Patrick Meenan

Commit-Queue: Tsuyoshi Horo

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1257129}

entry.title: [A11y] Clean up dirty object states and add assertions for them
entry.content:
This is a speculative fix for the crash in the referenced bug.

In the crash, SerializeEntireTree() hits a check that "has dirty

objects" is true, meaning that a previous serialization did not

complete.



Terminology -- two different concepts for "dirty" (we may want to

improve the terminology in a follow-up, so that the difference

between these concepts is less confusing):

1. AXObjectCacheImpl::IsDirty() means that the cache's tree updates

need to be processed so that it's stored tree is up to date.

2. AXObjectCacheImpl::HasDirtyObjects() means that there are objects

that haven't been serialized yet.



This CL adds checks to ensure that the 2 cache states related to

dirtiness have correct values before and after serializations,

when freezing, etc.



Fixes for triggered checks:

1. Return true from IsDirty() if the document has been marked dirty

via mark_all_dirty_, which ensures there's no chance of not

serializing in this case.

2. After processing tree updates, clean up any leftover aria-owns

changes in the relation cache that may have not been processed.



Bug: 1523372

Change-Id: I00d51660dc4fb255896ff75b0ea2b59784877389

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5249680

entry.title: Set Dictionary-ID request header when non-empty ID was specified
entry.content:
A new "id" option of "Use-As-Dictionary" header was specified by the

spec [1]. The "id" option is parsed by `ParseDictionaryHeaderInfo()`

method when V2 backend is enabled after [2].



This CL changes SharedDictionaryNetworkTransaction to set

"Dictionary-ID" header with the dictionary ID when the dictionary is

usable and the ID is not empty.

[2]: https://crrev.com/c/5248489

entry.title: media/gpu/ip: Add FrameResource support to image processors
entry.content:
This is done by making the image processor backends use FrameResource

natively. Any future ImageProcessorBackend will need to implement the

FrameResource-based ProcessFrame() method



The ImageProcessor class, which can be used to wrap an

ImageProcessorBackend, now has a FrameResource specific Process()

interface. The changes to image_processor.(cc|h) involve duplicating the

VideoFrame Process() functions, but the duplication could not be easily

avoided. Unfortunately, the VideoFrame versions cannot be removed unless

encoders migrate away from using VideoFrame.



In ImageProcessorBackend, a common Process() method handles wrapping

input and output VideoFrame objects as VideoFrameResource before calling

the implementation-specific FrameResource ProcessFrame() method.



The legacy image processor API, which is only supported by the V4L2

image processor, has not been changed in this commit. That migration is

in the next CL in this chain. For now, the V4L2ImageProcessorBackend has

been modified to convert the frames in the legacy calls from VideoFrame

to and from FrameResource. This lets the backend use FrameResource in

its JobRecord and avoid duplicating code for legacy processing.



Bug: b:277581596

Test: ImageProcessor tests pass using GL, LibYUV, VAAPI, and V4L2 IP's.

entry.title: documentScan: Reduce StartScan confirmation prompts
entry.content:
The first time an extension calls StartScan for a particular scanner

handle, Chrome verifies user approval through a confirmation dialog.

Subsequent StartScan requests on the same handle are automatically

approved so that the user doesn't have to approve every page of a

multi-page scan.



This reasoning can be extended further by automatically approving

subsequent user-initiated scan requests on the same scanner (same ID,

not by handle). The extension could already hold open the handle after

the first scan indefinitely, so this doesn't create any new access.

However, it reduces the number of times the user has to approve the same

scanner in cases where a new handle is needed (e.g. after refreshing the

list of scanners).



Approval is not saved permanently, so the user will have to approve the

scanner again after a logout or reboot.



Multiple scanner IDs may point to the same physical scanner in the case

of multiple protocols. These other scanner IDs are not automatically

approved so that the extension can't silently switch to a less secure

protocol without the user knowing.



Bug: b/312740272

Test: Scan with test extensions

entry.title: add test for not crashing with incorrect history shape
entry.content:
There was a crash report a while back that occurred when the user's

history pref was the incorrect shape. This happened because we swapped

from the pref being a list of token strings to a list of dict history

values, and the code was not checking for if the value in the List was a

dict before calling GetDict. This is a test to make sure that we do not

crash if we run into any leftovers of the old format.



The solution for the crash was actually done separate to the crash bug,

without knowledge that crashing was happening so no test was added at

the time.

entry.title: Animation: Avoid cc start-time preservation in rate changes
entry.content:
This CL avoids the codepath added in https://crrev.com/c/4605129 for

animation restarts as a result of a playback rate (or playback state)

change.



The above CL made it so that restarting a compositor animation preserves

the start time from the impl animation to avoid a race that clobbers it.

However, a changed play rate restarts the cc animation with a pending

play/pause, which causes an "async" update [1], meaning that an existing

`start_time` isn't used but instead sets a `time_offset` to preserve the

animation's current time. This relies on the fact that the compositor

will generate a new start time.



Also undo some expectation changes to tests made in the regressing

CL.



This is a minimal fix to merge to M122. A proper fix will follow.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/animation/animation.cc;l=2280;drc=d2b5c17eff35da6ebff8ba20c99688b87e1bc752



Bug: 41496930

entry.title: Add unit test verifying BMP Suite "questionable" cases.
entry.content:
Several of these have extremely minor color deltas compared to

the reference image. I suspect that the reference images are not

properly replicating bits in their odd-bit-width example images.

(i.e., a 6-bit value written into an 8-bit color channel should

repeat its top two bits in the lowest two bits so that full-

bright channels properly emit 0xFF, instead of 0xFC.)



We will be transitioning these tests onto Skia Gold in a followup

CL; as such, the reference images are only temporary.



Test images are public domain, created by BMP Suite 2.8.



Bug: 1523036

entry.content:
We used to need this code back when the a11y engine did not enforce the

frozen state of the tree, and the very act of serializing could queue

more updates. That's no longer true. We enforce that in a number of

places, and an additional CHECK() has been added to

AddDirtyObjectToSerializationQueue().



This must land before CL:5249680.

entry.title: [omnibox] Fix tabbing into keyword mode with non-empty user text.
entry.content:
crrev.com/c/5214733 moves a dcheck that breaks tabbing into keyword

mode when the user text is not empty. e.g. if a user's input is

"youtube.com query", then the user presses tab to enter keyword mode.

This is possible when the user backspaces out of keyword mode or has

the space keyboard shortcut turned off.



In this case, AcceptKeyword() calls UpdatePopup() to refresh the list of

suggestions. The focused selection updates from the keyword button to

the actual clickable keyword suggestion. This clickable keyword

suggestion is actually of selection type NORMAL, rather than

KEYWORD_MODE, breaking StepPopupSelection's assumption that the selection we've stepped into is the "next selection" (since the list got updated).



Longer term, it'd be good to have better delineation of actually being

"in" keyword mode vs having the button focused. For now, this is enough

of an edge case, moving the UpdatePopup to after we've finished stepping

the selection unbreaks that assumption.



Bug: 1521556

Change-Id: I4a40d922a96a63daea95d99ea347b6ee3cdbcef0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5260601

entry.title: [Tab] Add TabGroupId field to tab state
entry.content:
Add a Token (pair of long) field for TabGroupId to the TabState for

each tab. This implementation mirrors RootId as it is intended to

replace it in the long term. This CL does not use or write to the new

field it just adds serialization/deserialization capabilities and

tracks updates to the field.



Due to how TabState is designed. I don't believe it is possible to

flag guard the actual serialization and deserialization. We can only

flag guard the use of the field downstream.



The main aim with this ID is that it will be stable. i.e. tabs

moving between tab groups will not result in this ID changing for the

overall tab group.



For migration purposes root ID will need to continue to exist

for a reasonable migration period. However, once the tab group id is

launched we can eliminate the ability to modify the value. Later we

can follow up with a more complete cleanup that may result in loss of

tab groups for clients that don't update (on the order of years).



Bug: 1523745

Change-Id: Ic9980c5a3357f174665bf5b091c49679fa1aba0f

entry.title: [Tab Group] Move TabGroup out of TabGroupModelFilter
entry.content:
Move TabGroup out of the TabGroupModelFilter. For now this helps keep

the two classes from being two-way-dependent on one another and it helps

with readablility.



There are a couple logical changes:



1) TabGroup#addTab used to call TabGroupModelFilter#reorderGroup. This

prevented it from being a static class. This CL refactors this method

away so that the this is no longer required.

2) TabGroup#getTabIdForIndex made an array copy of the LinkedHashSet

then indexed into it. This is O(n) copy + O(1) lookup. Change this

to use iterators O(n) lookup and only offer methods for the

first and last elements since these were the only ones used.



Long term, I'd like to consider making TabGroup or at least an interface

it implements public from TabGroupModelFilter as a lot of operations

would be easier on a TabGroup class as compared to just a list of tabs.

However, for now TabGroup remains package scoped.

entry.title: [Android TRM] Use last_active_time instead of timestamp for tab recency.
entry.content:
The Tab Resumption Module extracts ForeignSessionTab data and needs to

compute tab recency for filtering and ranking. Previously the

|timestamp| field was used, but this is prone to frequent non-user

triggered website updates (e.g., from chat), which can also suffer from

spam.



Recently the |last_active_time| data from Sync is added to fix the

issue. To use it, we'd need to get ForeignSessionHelper (including the

native code) to make the data available.



This CL implements a simple solution: Add |last_active_time| field to

ForeignSessionTab. Many tests instantiate ForeignSessionTab directly,

and these are updated as needed (a hack would be to add another CTOR to

copy |timestamp| to |last_active_time| -- we chose not to do this).



Also, in SuggestionEntry: Replace |timestamp| with |lastActiveTime|.



Bug: 1515325

Change-Id: I2fb5366b2f2b8937736b4d5a6051701c2c1de9f4

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5268982

entry.title: [Protected Audiences] Rework permissions policy warnings.
entry.content:
Display Protected Audience permissions policy warnings only when a

call would be blocked if a feature were switched to EnableForSelf.

Previously, permissions policy warnings would be displayed for

cross-origin iframes whenever the policy wasn't EnableForAll,

regardless of whether or not permission was also explicitly granted,

which could be confusing to users.



To do this, make permission policy helper AllowlistFromDeclaration()

public (instead of a private static method), and have

AdAuctionServiceImpl walk the frame stack up to the root frame,

checking if the allowlist of every cross-origin iframe has the

relevant permission explicitly set, whenever a method affected by the

policy is invoked. This logic is only accurate when a feature is

enabled, so it doesn't need to worry about any case where the feature

is explicitly disabled (by iframe properties or HTTP headers).



Bug: 40266491

Change-Id: Ie5a551bff054335f72cd34b2e7f00c620bab3a7a

and ChromeOS and Android Browser:

due to [1], so the IPC is never bypassed [2].

entry.content:

as it enabled the feature too broadly, causing issues in various

the field trial testing config, so now we can re-enable Vulkan

specifically on rex.

entry.title: Reland "[A11y] Invalidate AXIDs when those objects are removed"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 408b51a92e5ccbaf4d6da2562651893186834e4c



Reason for revert: tests leaked. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/test-analysis/b/5765548086394880



Original change's description:

> [A11y] Invalidate AXIDs when those objects are removed

>

> After CL:4185636, an AXObject may have been detached and recreated

> with the same DOM node, and therefore has the same id (the dom node id).

> This breaks the accessibility object caching mechanism used for web

> tests, which assumes that if it sees the same ID, it can assume the

> object is still the same one. The fix is to notify the caching

> mechanism of detached AXObjects so that it can invalidate the

> corresponding entries.

>

> Bug: none

> Change-Id: I152538644f9dc24d4e7fbfe68057deb4ab4d34aa

entry.title: shortcuts: Set positional lookups for all accelerator maps
entry.content:
Fixes a bug where the accelerator map lookup would not be set

properly whenever `RestoreAllDefaults()` gets called.

`accelerator_to_id_` gets assigned the value of

`default_accelerators_to_id_cache_` whenever all accelerators

are restored to default. The issue is that this includes the

field `use_positional_lookup`, which is not set properly in

`default_accelerators_to_id_cache_`.



The fix here is to ensure all mappings have the correct

field set when the IME updates.

entry.title: Revert "[Android TRM] Use last_active_time instead of timestamp for tab recency."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 09f8d8d5b9f04da2b9a60f79388f70e5d8f9d7cb.



Reason for revert: After discussion, we're favoring alternative approach crrev.com/c/5268982 .



Original change's description:

> [Android TRM] Use last_active_time instead of timestamp for tab recency.

>

> The Tab Resumption Module extracts ForeignSessionTab data and needs to

> compute tab recency for filtering and ranking. Previously the

> |timestamp| field was used, but this is prone to frequent non-user

> triggered website updates (e.g., from chat), which can also suffer from

> spam.

>

> Recently the |last_active_time| data from Sync is added to fix the

> problem. To use it, we'd need to get ForeignSessionHelper (including the

> native code) to make the data available.

>

> This CL does the above, favoring an "additive" approach to avoid unduly

> affecting existing functionality. Details:

> * ForeignSessionHelper:

> * Add class ForeignSessionTabWithLastActiveTime, which extends

> ForeignSessionTab, to have extra |lastActiveTime| field. This allows

> old code that uses ForeignSessionTab to stay the same.

> * Add getForeignSessionsForTabResumptionModule() as replacement of

> getForeignSessions() for TRM usage, with the same interface.

> * Add pushTabWithLastActiveTime() for native code to supply the

> |lastActiveTime| data, to instantiate the new class.

> * foreign_session_helper.{cc,h}:

> * Add class Options with |get_last_active_time| field.

> * Add GetForeignSessionsForTabResumptionModule() for use by the

> Java counterpart.

> * Extract common code to GetForeignSessionsInternal() (private).

> * Change JNI_ForeignSessionHelper_CopyTabToJava() to selectively

> instantiate ForeignSessionTabWithLastActiveTime if specified.

> * SuggestionEntry: Rename `timestamp` field to |timeForUi| to enforce

> proper semantics.

> * ForeignSessionTabResumptionDataProvider: Change to use

> getForeignSessionsForTabResumptionModule() and |lastActiveTime|.

> * Explicit down-casting is applied

> * TestSupport: Update to use ForeignSessionTabWithLastActiveTime, and

> add a few |timestamp| vs. |lastActiveTime| skew in test data.

>

> Bug: 1515325

> Change-Id: I1acfc20f70066cf25b8ebab4fd74993100e42876

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5269522

> Reviewed-by: Calder Kitagawa

> Reviewed-by: Xi Han

> Commit-Queue: Samuel Huang

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1256952}

entry.title: [Protected Audiences] Warn when seller scripts access renderUrl.
entry.content:
Add warnings to browserSignals.renderUrl accesses made in scoreAd() and

reportWin().



This CL splits up LazyFiller into two classes - one for general use,

and another for use within the scope of ContextRecycler. The latter

isn't really necessary (since we never call Reset() on a generic

LazyFiller object we could just call Reset() on specific subclasses),

but it makes sense to have the documentation about the Reset() method

in one place, so this creates a PersistentLazyFiller subclass of

LazyFiller. PersistentLazyFiller just has a virtual Reset() method,

which LazyFiller is the same as before, except without the Reset()

method.
